item.title: Libby add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Libby add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Libby add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I don't know anything with certainty, but seeing the stars makes me dream." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Libby add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I’m here. I love you. I don’t care if you need to stay up crying all night long, I will stay with you. There’s nothing you can ever do to lose my love. I will protect you until you die, and after your death I will still protect you. I am stronger than Depression and I am braver than Loneliness and nothing will ever exhaust me." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Libby add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Prayer is a relationship; half the job is mine. If I want transformation, but can't even be bothered to articulate what, exactly, I'm aiming for, how will it ever occur? Half the benefit of prayer is in the asking itself, in the offering of a clearly posed and well-considered intention. If you don't have this, all your pleas and desires are boneless, floppy, inert; they swirl at your feet in a cold fog and never lift." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Libby add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I think I deserve something beautiful." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Libby add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "...once I falsely hoped to meet the beings who, pardoning my outward form, would love me for the excellent qualities which I was capable of unfolding." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Libby add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Libby add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I don't mind living in a man's world, as long as I can be a woman in it." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Libby add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I don't want to make money, I just want to be wonderful." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Libby add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Libby add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Libby add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Libby add a quote by Stella Adler
item.description: "life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one" -- Stella Adler

item.title: Libby add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Imagination governs the world." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Libby add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Libby add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Libby add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Libby add a quote by Henri Matisse
item.description: "Creativity takes courage. " -- Henri Matisse

item.title: Libby add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Libby add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw
